title: QuantumScape (QS) Q3 2023: prototype solid-state test cells exceed performance targets
notes:
Location: N/A

Capacity: N/A

Investment amounts: QuantumScape raised $300 million in gross proceeds in the past three months, bringing the total liquidity to $1.1 billion. The company's current forecast allows for continued solid-state cell development into 2026.

Project progress: QuantumScape has made significant progress in developing its solid-state battery technology, from single-layer prototype cell testing to delivering the first 24-layer A0 prototype cells to automotive partners for testing. The company is now focused on turning the corner from prototype to product, with key milestones aimed at advancing product development to enable initial production of the QSE-5.

Project type: N/A

Value chain stages: QuantumScape is focused on the development of its QSE-5 solid-state cell, which is designed to deliver a capacity of around 5 amp-hours. The company has completed equipment installation for its "Raptor" fast separator heat treatment process and continues to make progress in implementing its "Cobra" process to support the QSE-5 B0 prototype production in the future.

title: QuantumScape considers cell production in Salzgitter
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is planned to be located in Salzgitter, Germany.

Capacity:
- The initial capacity of the planned pilot plant, QS-1, is 1 GWh, with a future expansion to a total capacity of 21 GWh for series production.

Investment amounts:
- Volkswagen has invested $100 million in QuantumScape, the US battery specialist.

Project progress:
- The location for the pilot plant with Volkswagen is to be determined this year.
- The final decision on further steps towards a solid fuel cell pilot plant in Salzgitter will be made in the fourth quarter at the latest.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with the construction of a pilot plant called QS-1.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover cell fabrication, as it will bring QuantumScape’s core battery technology into industrial production with Volkswagen's support.

title: 3 Reasons to Buy QuantumScape Stock, and 1 Reason to Sell
notes:
Location: N/A

Capacity: N/A

Investment amounts: QuantumScape raised an additional $288 million in cash through stock sales in the summer of 2023. It ended Q3 with $1.1 billion in cash and short-term investments and zero debt.

Project progress: QuantumScape is shipping prototype battery cells to prospective customers for testing. It is also working on a solid-state lithium-metal battery platform and has engaged in a small project for EV production featuring its first production-ready battery, the QSE-5. The company has hired an executive with manufacturing experience, indicating a shift from research and development to battery production focus.

Project type: N/A

Value chain stages: QuantumScape is working on a solid-state lithium-metal battery platform, focusing on replacing traditional lithium-ion battery anodes with pure lithium-metal. It is also engaged in prototype battery cell shipping and production-ready battery development.

title: VW Invests $100M in QuantumScape, a Battery-Building Unicorn
notes:
Location:
N/A

Capacity:
N/A

Investment amounts:
Volkswagen Group raised its stake in QuantumScape with a $100 million investment. Other investors in QuantumScape include Kleiner Perkins, Prelude Ventures, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Capricorn Investment Group, and Khosla Ventures. 

Project progress:
QuantumScape, founded in 2010, has been in development for over eight years and aims to achieve full production by 2025 in a joint venture with Volkswagen. 

Project type:
The project involves the development of solid-state battery technology, specifically focusing on lithium metal anodes.

Value chain stages:
The project is focused on the development of solid-state battery technology, particularly in the area of lithium metal anodes.

title: QuantumScape & Volkswagen Sign Agreement for Joint Venture
notes:
Location:
- The joint-venture solid-state battery pilot-line facility, QS-1, is planned to be located in Salzgitter, Germany.

Capacity:
- The initial capacity of the QS-1 facility is planned to be 1 gigawatt hour (GWh) for battery cell commercial production. There are intentions to expand the production capacity by a further 20 GWh at the same location.

Investment amounts:
- QuantumScape announced an additional $100 million in funding from Volkswagen after confirming through tests at its labs in Germany that QuantumScape cells met the established technical milestone.

Project progress:
- QuantumScape has secured a facility in San Jose to house the QS-0 line, which is the planned pre-pilot line. The company also announced it was doubling the initial QS-0 capacity to over 200,000 cells annually.

Project type:
- The project involves the establishment of a joint-venture solid-state battery pilot-line facility, QS-1, in Salzgitter, Germany.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover cell fabrication for electric vehicle batteries.

title: Volkswagen begins construction of battery cell factory
notes:
Location:
- The battery factory project is located in Salzgitter, Germany.

Capacity:
- The factory is planned to produce the Volkswagen unit cell for volume models starting from 2025.

Investment amounts:
- The total investment by PowerCo (with partners) is planned to be 20 billion euros by 2030.
- The project did not claim any state subsidies for the battery factory in Salzgitter.

Project progress:
- The factory is in the initial stages, with the symbolic laying of the foundation stone having taken place. The factory is expected to start operations in 2025.
- The factory will be part of the VW Group’s “Global Battery Hub” and will develop, test, manufacture, and recycle batteries at the component plant.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with the factory being constructed from scratch.

Value chain stages:
- The factory will cover the entire value chain stages, including cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

Additional notes:
- The factory is part of the PowerCo business unit and will serve as a blueprint for other locations, with the first plants scheduled to be installed in Salzgitter as early as the second quarter of 2023.
- The factory will produce a prismatic battery cell to be used in 80% of the VW Group’s e-vehicles in the future, allowing for flexibility and standardization in production.
- The project aims for rapid scaling, with the ability to produce a wide variety of cell chemistries on one line to react to customer demand and supply chain variations.
- The factory will be powered exclusively by green electricity, and the company plans to secure the local supply of green electricity at other locations as well.
- The company plans to announce the locations of the three cell factories in the coming months, with one to be built in Eastern Europe and the locations of plants 5 and 6 yet to be confirmed.
- PowerCo intends to supply battery cells to customers outside the VW Group, starting with large-scale storage systems and eventually supplying cells to other carmakers.
